bugs.title: CVE-2022-41723 google-guest-agent: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41723 google-guest-agent: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41723 net/http, golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding

long_desc.thetext:
CVE-2022-41723 : net/http: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding

A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumption in the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a small number of small requests.

This issue is also fixed in golang.org/x/net/http2 v0.7.0, for users manually configuring HTTP/2.

https://go.dev/issue/57855
https://pkg.go.dev/vuln/GO-2023-1571
https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/V0aBFqaFs_E

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2178358

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2178358,2178465

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: Review Request: google-guest-agent - Google Compute Engine guest environment

bugzilla.short_desc: Review Request: google-guest-agent - Google Compute Engine guest environment

blocked.short_desc: Missing packages breaking Fedora Google Cloud image build

long_desc.thetext:
As mentioned in a pagure issue[0], I retired some packages for Fedora on Google Cloud Platform due to challenges with maintenance. Upstream's dependency requirements were difficult to meet with Fedora's package sets.

I'm working to unretire these packages and bundle the golang dependencies into two of the problematic ones. See the tickets linked to this one.

[0] https://pagure.io/cloud-sig/issue/421

Reproducible: Always
Updates done for rawhide + f40.

Spec URL: https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/mhayden/google-cloud-unretired/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/07282279-google-guest-agent/google-guest-agent.spec
SRPM URL: https://download.copr.fedorainfracloud.org/results/mhayden/google-cloud-unretired/fedora-rawhide-x86_64/07282279-google-guest-agent/google-guest-agent-20240314.00-1.fc41.src.rpm
Description: Google Compute Engine guest environment
Fedora Account System Username: mhayden

This is a review to *unretire* the package.

FEDORA-2024-74c4c65ff6 (google-guest-agent-20240314.00-4.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-74c4c65ff6

FEDORA-2024-74c4c65ff6 (google-guest-agent-20240314.00-4.fc41) has been pushed to the Fedora 41 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
